definition: leisurely/unhurried/sluggish
slow
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.chinese: 進展慢騰騰得叫人泄氣。

sentences.english: She trekked down to the library.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢騰騰地走到圖書館。

sentences.english: He wiped his hands on his fatigue trousers with a slow thorough motion .
sentences.chinese: 他慢騰騰一絲不苟地把手在破褲子上擦了幾擦。

sentences.english: At last they heard feet coming slowly towards the door.
sentences.chinese: 最後他們終於聽到了腳步慢騰騰地向門口走來。

sentences.english: I'm to be late for my date.
sentences.chinese: 我約會要晚了，你總是那麼慢慢騰騰的。

sentences.english: Then, belatedly, an umbrella of governance would be added.
sentences.chinese: 然後，才慢騰騰的添加治理這把保護傘。

sentences.english: In the centre of the yard, a few loose chickens were sluggishly wandering around.
sentences.chinese: 在院子裏，還有幾隻散放的雞在慢騰騰地走着。

sentences.english: She turned, and went deliberately out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 她扭過身去，慢騰騰地從房裏走出去。

sentences.english: "We shall, dearest, of course; next year. " Her voice lingered over it.
sentences.chinese: “我們當然會的，親愛的，到明年，”她慢騰騰地說。

sentences.english: I heard footsteps slowly coming down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見有腳步聲慢騰騰地走下樓來。

sentences.english: Then slowly tell side juniors, I go, there is no.
sentences.chinese: 然後慢騰騰地告訴身旁的晚輩，我走了，就沒有了。

sentences.english: Cloud is wearing a smile to very slowly sit down to go, deep breathing.
sentences.chinese: 雲含笑慢慢騰騰的坐下去，深呼吸。
韓佳，我這怎麼叫慢騰騰。

sentences.english: I'm to be late for my date. You're so, you're always so sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 我約會要晚了，你總是那麼慢慢騰騰的。

sentences.english: The old man drank his coffee slowly.
sentences.chinese: 老人慢騰騰地喝着咖啡。

definition: armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
needlework/sewing
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
see 屎蚵螂[shi3 ke1 lang2]
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
pinkeye/envy/jealousy
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
